column4: Statoil  partners study Troll post-2020 output expansion
column5: OSLO  June 20 Norwegian oil firm Statoil  and its partners are studying the possibilities of expanding gas production at Norway's biggest field  Troll  after 2020  the company said on Monday.

column4: Toyota to build artificial intelligence-based driving systems in five years
column5: TOKYO Toyota Motor Corp is targeting developing in the next five years driver assistance systems that integrate artificial intelligence (AI) to improve vehicle safety  the head of its advanced research division said.

column4: Twitter buys machine-learning firm Magic Pony to boost image content
column5: Twitter Inc  said on Monday it acquired London-based Magic Pony Technology  a machine-learning startup that specializes in working with images  to deliver better video and picture content.

column4: Visa launches Olympics campaign  undeterred by woes in Brazil
column5: Visa Inc  one of the Olympics' top global sponsors  kicks off its global advertising campaign for the Summer Games on Sunday with no plans to cut back on its Olympic presence despite difficulties in host country Brazil.
